answers.answer: Hi!Well, yes, three weeks of laxative use can start showing side effects like loose stools, electrolyte imbalance, dehydration etc. However, the changes should usually be reversible on stopping the laxative. Long-term use over months can cause serious side effects. You are young and hence will recover faster. Just make a conscious effort to increase fiber in your diet and eat healthy. Remember to drink plenty of fluids (water, lime juice, clear soups, fresh juice etc).If you again become constipated then consult your doctor to first find the cause and then start treatment. Chronic constipation can be due to diet poor in roughage or fiber, dehydration, diabetes, hypothyroidism, colon disorders, irritable bowel syndrome, diverticular diseases, cancers, severe acidity etc. It can also be due to milk allergy and other food allergies. A comprehensive investigation would then be taken keeping all the points in mind.I sincerely hope you will find this information useful in your journey towards better health.Hope you get well soon! Good Luck and take care!

title: Laxatives abuse?
